intro: Croixia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded crocus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers with a distinctive, spurred petal at the base. Its leaves are grass-like and form a dense rosette near the ground. The plant prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
